extract.html: A car of mass 1000 kg brakes from 24 m/s on a dry road. Braking force is approximately constant. A data logger records speed vs time and stopping distance. Ignore air resistance.

questions.prompt: Q1. If the average braking force is 5000 N, find the deceleration a. (Use F = m a.)
Q2. From 24 m/s to rest under constant deceleration a=5.0 m/s^2, estimate stopping distance using v^2 = u^2 + 2 a s.
Q3. In reality stopping distance is longer. Name one factor that increases it.
